item.title: Data Beyond Vision
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser, Gissoo Doroudian, Nick Budak, Xinyi Li
item.description: How do we represent tangible objects in a visual medium? We use words, pictures, and diagrams. We describe, share, show, and fail.

item.title: Print a model of the Shakespeare and Company Lending Library Membership
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser
item.description: Close up of 3D printed lollipop chart with labels.Photo by Shelley Szwast ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ | FIGURE. Alternating rows of white and green “lollipops” fade into the distance and out of focus, with the white data points noticeably larger in the foreground. | | CAPTION: Close up of 3D printed lollipop chart with labels. | ATTRIBUTION: Photo by Shelley Szwast ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ Print a model of Shakespeare and Company lending library membership by date, as described in Data Beyond Vision.

item.title: Stack Shakespeare and Company Membership Activities
item.author: Xinyi Li, Rebecca Sutton Koeser
item.description: Close-up of the finished model of membership activities of Shakespeare and Company Library ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ | FIGURE. A partition of a paper model against dark background with years printed on the base. | | CAPTION: Close-up of the finished model of membership activities of Shakespeare and Company Library ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ Create your own kirigami model of Shakespeare and Company lending library membership activities, as described in Data Beyond Vision.

item.title: Their Data, Ourselves: Illness as Information
item.author: Rebecca Munson
item.description: When I was growing up I liked to read about dying children. I’m not talking about the Victorian orphan kind of dying, not the dying of storybooks, but children who were terminally ill.

item.title: Weave Derrida's References
item.author: Gissoo Doroudian
item.description: Completed weaving of the first 13 pages of Derrida’s references in chapter 1 of Of Grammatology.Photo by Shelley Szwast ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ | FIGURE. A scarf with alternating bands of blue fabrics resting on a table. | | CAPTION: Completed weaving of the first 13 pages of Derrida’s references in chapter 1 of Of Grammatology | ATTRIBUTION: Photo by Shelley Szwast ⩩———————————————————————————–⟩ Create your own data weaving of Derrida’s references in chapter 1 of Of Grammatology, as described in Data Beyond Vision.

item.title: About
item.description: <dl> <dt>startword, <abbr title="noun">n.</abbr></dt> <dd>(computer science) A string of letters that identifies the beginning of a valid sequence in a specified language.</dd> <dd>(literature) The first appearance of a genre in print.</dd> </dl>

item.title: Weaving as interface
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser, Gissoo Doroudian
item.description: deepzoom experiment -- body { background-color: black; } .highlight { /*border: 3px solid yellow;*/ } .highlight:hover { border: 3px solid yellow; } .pnum { text-decoration: none; color: white; font-size: 22pt; } /* .pnum::after { content: '1'; font-size: 22pt; display: block; color: white; } */ .reference { position: absolute; padding: 20px; left: 0; bottom: 0; width: 450px; height: 350px; background-color: white; z-index: 3; opacity: 0; -webkit-transition: opacity 1.
